.class public auto ansi sealed TransformedBitmap extends System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource implements class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> supports only orthogonal transforms such as rotation transforms of 90Â° increments and scale transforms. Transforms that skew the image are not supported.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. Property changes can only occur during object initialization. Call <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> to signal that initialization has begun and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.EndInit%2A> to signal that initialization has completed. After initialization, property changes are ignored.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap> objects created using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TransformedBitmap.%23ctor%28System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Transform%29> constructor are automatically initialized and property changes are ignored.
Metadata tags related to image data must be updated if an image is saved to a file after a transform is applied.

## Remarks This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
